did.abstract: This collection includes minutes, rules and regulations, and documents on the appointments of firemen from the Flatbush Fire Company, which was established in 1829.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Flatbush Fire Company was established by the Board of Trustees of the town of Flatbush in September 1829. The town of Flatbush was annexed into what was then the City of Brooklyn in 1894.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Flatbush Fire Company records, 1978.019, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes a bound minute book, loose minutes of meetings, rules and regulations, and appointments of firemen. Also included is one certificate of appointment to the Fire Department of William Algeo, Jr.
